grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 詠歌【エイカ】poem (esp. tanka), song, composition of a poem or song, pilgrim's song, pilgrim's hymn, singing a poem or song in a loud voice
朗詠【ロウエイ】recitation (of Japanese or Chinese poem)
遺詠【イエイ】posthumous song or poem
kun reading compounds: 詠む【よむ】to compose (a Japanese poem), to write, to use as the theme of a poem, to recite (e.g. a poem), to chant, to intone
歌う【うたう】to sing, to sing (one's praises in a poem, etc.), to compose a poem, to recite a poem
